intro: Dactylorhiza carpatica, commonly known as the Carpathian orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the Carpathian Mountains. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its erect, leafy stems and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer, producing pink to purple flowers with a distinctive lip. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in many regions.
